comments.body:
i think the `COUNT 2` here was on purpose (asking more than we're gonna get)
any reason you changed that?
```suggestion
        set reply [r XAUTOCLAIM mystream mygroup consumer2 10 $cursor COUNT 2]
```
I just changed it to verify we return "0-0" in such a case

you mean in the case we asked for exactly the number of elements that remain?
you think there's a chance this case would have a bug that doesn't also happen when you ask for more?

anyway, you're saying that the other test (`XAUTOCLAIM as an iterator`) has coverage for this (running out of entries and asking for more than there are), right?

> you mean in the case we asked for exactly the number of elements that remain?
you think there's a chance this case would have a bug that doesn't also happen when you ask for more?

yes

> anyway, you're saying that the other test (XAUTOCLAIM as an iterator) has coverage for this (running out of entries and asking for more than there are), right?

yes - `XAUTOCLAIM can claim PEL items from another consumer` covers this

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +454,458 @@
        # Claim last entry
        set reply [r XAUTOCLAIM mystream mygroup consumer2 10 $cursor COUNT 1]
        assert_equal [llength $reply] 2
        set cursor [lindex $reply 0]
